intro: Kalopanax septemlobus subsp. septemlobus, commonly known as the seven-lobed cow-itch, is a deciduous shrub native to eastern Asia. It belongs to the family Araliaceae and is characterized by its compound leaves with seven distinct lobes. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers that are clustered in umbels, followed by edible, spiny fruits. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for both ecological and horticultural study.
